description:

We are seeking a talented Senior UI Designer with significant experience in delivering best-in-class UI work in customer facing Mobile App, Websites and CRM.

Sitting in the Customer brand team, but working closely with the Customer Product Owner and UX/ User Researcher, this role supports the Greggs Customer and Technology teams in delivering the best possible visual identity to an exciting suite of innovative, greenfield products that will ensure that both digital and physical in-store experiences work seamlessly for our customers and colleagues to deliver a great overall experience.

all channels and formats.

You will have a proactive, can-do attitude and enjoy contributing towards an adaptive, fun and creative environment. You will be capable of working cross functionally and facilitating and collaborating with multiple stakeholder groups.

You will be a lifelong learner and will enjoy joining us on a continuous journey of learning and improving as we strive to become a high-performing, self-organising product team, applying adaptive planning techniques to deliver innovative solutions to business problems.

You will care about delivering high-quality products that are closely aligned to the needs of our customers and our business.

You will be curious, inquisitive and will enjoy delighting our customers.

Location

This is a full-time, permanent role based at Greggs Innovate House, Newcastle upon Tyne.

Salary

Upto £50,000 depending on experience.

Work Pattern

Our working hours are usually Monday - Friday however we are open to discuss flexibility with regards to this working pattern with the successful candidate.

What you'll do
• As a part of our Customer Brand Team, you will help to shape and develop our brand identity across all digital channels, and champion the consistent application of our brand across the business
• Working with the brand, teams to turn brand identity, campaign assets and creative into content within our digital products.
• Work with the Customer Product Owner and UX/User researcher to iterate and expand on wireframes, user flows flows, low fidelity mock-ups, interactive prototypes and design specifications.
• Create hi-fidelity UI work for the development team to help deliver new feature enhancements.
• Develop ad-hoc visuals and content in relation to our digital products for internal and external use.
• Lead our User-Centred Design practices at Greggs and championing design thinking to help educate and communicate to the wider team as to why design is important.
• Collaborate with our content lead and wider brand team and support agencies to ensure that all work is aligned, delighting our customers and delivering to Greggs overall commercial objectives.

About you
• Proven experience of delivering best-in-class visual designs for mobile app, websites and CRM activity.
• Experience of working in a similar role within a consumer-facing digital product team, ideally within a major retailer or consumer facing FMCG business.
• Highly skilled in the use of Figma as well as various industry standard software tools, such as Adobe CC, InVision, Miro, Sketch etc.
• Experience in translating brand identity into a coherent design system.
• Highly commercially savvy, and able to turn concepts into engaging visual content.
• Comfortable working with a variety of agency partners and perspectives to arrive at the best solution for end-users.
• Has a detailed knowledge of User-Centred Design practices
• Has a portfolio demonstrating outstanding visual flair and design.
• Is adept at using qualitative and quantitative data and insight to inform design thinking.
• Has a solid understanding the last designs tools and online marketing practices.
• Leads with accessibility best practice in mind at all time.
• Has a keen eye for detail - you’re a bit of a pixel perfectionist.
• Has experience designing for desktop, tablet and mobile.
• Enjoys bringing the wider team along with them and has experience communicating design decisions to the wider team and stakeholders.
• Has experience working in an agile environment.
• Experience in front-end development using the latest technologies.

What we can offer

As well as working with a great team we have the following fantastic benefits to offer the right candidate;
• You will be invited to participate in our Management Bonus Scheme which is worth up to 12.5% of your salary, subject to the Company meeting certain performance criteria
• Your holiday entitlement starts at 25 days (pro-rated for part time), in addition to Bank Holidays, which increases with service up to a maximum of 31days after 25 years’ service (pro-rata for part time)
• After 6 months service you may be eligible for our profit share scheme
• You will automatically join our Greggs pension scheme which is a fantastic way to save for your retirement and allows you to benefit from employer contributions and tax advantages
• If you elect to join the Management Pension Scheme then you will receive free life assurance. This is a death in service benefit which provides a lump-sum payment equal to 4 times your annual salary
• Private Medical Insurance which is free to you and subsidised for your dependants
• Permanent Health Insurance which is a replacement income scheme should you be unable to work
• Our Greggs Employee Discount Scheme is very generous, offering you up to 50% off our food

About Greggs

Here at Greggs, we love what we do and we have fun! What makes Greggs so special is our culture – the way we are, the way we behave and the way we support each other.

We're hard-working, but above all else we're family; and it doesn't matter who you are, where you're from or what your favourite bake is, we’d love you to join us!

We want everyone to feel welcome at Greggs and our colleagues to be able to be themselves at work, whatever their background, preferences, or views.

We recognise the importance of having diverse teams and the positive impact this can have and we actively encourage applications from all backgrounds.

Next steps

If you don’t already have a profile on the Greggs Family site, set one up and you’ll be ready to apply for any roles that take your fancy. If you need help or have any questions, we are here for you

description:
We see ourselves as a new civilisation of people emerging to make the world of gaming better. We’re a different breed of games company - we do things our own way in our own style, not necessarily following what’s been done before.

Our people are at the heart of our evolution and we nurture them to be their best. Without them our vision would fail.

We strive to avoid crunch, overtime is optional and always paid, and we offer flexible working hours to allow you to enjoy a normal family life whilst making great games.

We’ve helped millions to fight their way through fearsome mobs in Minecraft Dungeons, battle each other and the environment in Rust: Console Edition and most recently worked with Bethesda Game Studios to craft new adventures for Vault Dwellers around the world in Fallout 76.

We’re growing rapidly and as a result we’re looking for a UI Designer to join our studio in Middlesbrough (UK), home to the beautiful North Yorkshire coastline and countryside. As a UI Designer at... Double Eleven, you’ll demonstrate a player-focused approach to building game interfaces that are functional, intuitive and fun to use, from full menu systems to feedback HUDs. With the support of a Lead Designer, your role will include producing flows, annotated wireframes/mockups, and visual designs, which under your guidance are then developed into final quality UIs by our artists, for console and/or PC.

In this role you will set up camp at our HQ in Middlesbrough. We are continuing to assess the covid-19 situation, and our studio is set-up with the necessary covid-19 support measures to keep our teams safe. The wellbeing of our teams is at the heart of everything we do, and we are keen that all our teams feel safe and reassured.

Strictly no agencies (sorry guys!) and we’re unable to sponsor a visa for this role.

We can support UK relocation and have a dedicated People team on standby to assist you and your family with every step to us.

We kindly ask all applicants to submit a portfolio to support their application. We’re afraid applications without an accompanying portfolio will not be considered.

WOULD YOU ENJOY
• Helping to create beautiful games
• Being part of an amazing team working on multiple AAA titles
• Being trusted to work independently and proactively to the highest standards
• Working with experienced teams in the industry

What You’ll Be Doing
• Work with Design to conceptualise and produce creative and effective UI solutions that are intuitive, user-friendly and define the game experience.
• Produce high quality, considered and annotated UI designs, flows and/or interactive prototypes to showcase your work to the project’s creative leads.
• Collaborate with other departments to guide the path of your UI Designs through their development and implementation.
• Ensure and maintain consistent UI systems, controls and language across the game.
• Review and evaluate your work to ensure that the UI is integrated correctly.
• Ensure that our UI designs appeal to a broad audience, across various platforms, with a focus on accessibility.
• Understand the requirements and creative vision of the product, receive feedback and make adjustments when required.
• Evaluate the findings and feedback from QA, playtesters, and our gamers, to refine the UI to make a great user experience.
• Become the ‘go-to' person for UI designs across the game, championing a high level of quality and player experience throughout.
• Take a proactive approach to foresee problems and provide solutions that are mindful of a project’s scope and timescales.

What We’re Looking For
• Proven experience in developing front-facing user-interfaces for games on console and/or PC.
• A solid understanding of human-centred design practice and demonstration of the design thinking process in your work.
• An excellent working knowledge of Adobe products including Photoshop, Illustrator and XD and/or Figma or Sketch.
• Experience working with and creating interactive UI mockups, in Adobe XD or similar packages, to clearly articulate the vision of your UIs.
• An ability to solve UX problems through UI, from controls and player messaging, to localization and UIs geared towards PC and Console.
• An ability to create exceptional wireframes that demonstrate a strong understanding of player interaction, messaging, controls and attention to detail.
• An ability to annotate and explain your designs clearly and confidently to other disciplines and stakeholders.
• An ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
• Experience in user-testing, player analysis and iteration.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
• A portfolio showcasing a variety of design work in different styles.
• A strong passion for games on all platforms and an excellent understanding of what makes them work.

Skills Considered a Bonus
• An ability to multitask and understand priorities whilst working under limited supervision.
• Experience in prototyping / rapid concept iteration.
• An ability to work with coders to suggest and develop in house UI tools to aid with the implementation or iteration of UIs
• Knowledge and experience of game engines (Unity/Unreal), scripting (Java/Lua)
• All other relevant qualifications considered.

Qualifications
• All qualifications considered

We’re pretty sure we’re the best place to work, period.

Some of our benefits include:
• Competitive salary which is regularly benchmarked against the market as well as an annual pay review as part of an appraisal
• Flexible start time (start anytime between 8:00am and 10:00am)
• Flexible lunch hours
